rename.from: Unecessary warning for date_input widget with default value beeing modificated from session state key as well
rename.to: Unecessary warning for date_input widget with default value rewritten by session state api

body:
Hey @eduardochaves1 üëã 

Here's how you can workaround the issue. Use one session state variable to hold the default value (e.g. "custom_date"), and another to assign as the widget key (e.g. "date_key"). If the widget key doesn't exist in session state, assign the default value to the former variable:

```python
import datetime
import streamlit as st

min_date = datetime.date(2020, 1, 1)
max_date = datetime.date(2020, 12, 31)

if "date_key" not in st.session_state:
    st.session_state["custom_date"] = min_date

st.date_input(
    "Date:",
    min_value=min_date,
    max_value=max_date,
    value=st.session_state["custom_date"],
    key="date_key",
)

st.write(st.session_state["date_key"])
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20672874/220635140-91511da5-f4e1-42d3-a23f-38b8059bad5c.png)

Yes, it solves the warning problem, but then I have another problem that I should've said before on this issue (my bad).

In the real project I'm working on, I have a reset date button like that:

```python
import streamlit as st
import datetime

min_date = datetime.date(2020,1,1)
max_date = datetime.date(2020,12,31)

if 'date_key' not in st.session_state:
  st.session_state['custom_date'] = min_date

st.date_input('Date:', min_value=min_date, max_value=max_date, value=st.session_state['custom_date'], key='date_key')

if st.button('Reset Date', type='primary'):
  st.session_state['date_key'] = min_date

st.write(st.session_state['date_key'])
```

And when I try to reset the date with the session state key, this error shows up:

![Screenshot from 2023-02-22 11-05-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/95307858/220644941-613e39e9-8419-4db7-b5a5-5e786dfac13d.png)

This looks to me like a validation issue. If a key is provided, the value in that key should be used for validation instead of a default value defined by streamlit. This should just work:

```python
import streamlit as st
import datetime

min_date = datetime.date(2020,1,1)
max_date = datetime.date(2020,12,31)

if 'custom_date' not in st.session_state:
    st.session_state['custom_date'] = min_date

st.date_input('Date', min_value=min_date, max_value=max_date, key='custom_date')
```

Did you paste the right code on that message? Because it doesn't have the reset button I said I was using on my project. And it gives the same error I was talking before that the default value date_input sets (if not specified) is the device current date, in which 2023 is greater than the max_date which is 2020

I think I didn't make myself clear enough. "This should just work" was intended to mean "it doesn't actually work and I consider that to be a bug". I think your step 3 in the **Steps To Reproduce** section of your report is the right thing to do in this case, and if it worked (which it doesn't) I wouldn't care about the warning in step 2.

Ow yea, I'd say it needs some modification, cause in my mind it should get the default value from the key when `value` not declared, or maybe set up some conditionals for instead of using the current date, use the min or max value **when** they're declared in the function call

I had a meeting with my boss and we decided to remove the default value AND the max_value as well, so then the warning doesn't show anymore and it doesn't give an error for the current date been greater than the max_value. The downside is that the user can now selects a date till 2031, but for me is better than having a warning. For now was the best option for us.

@eduardochaves1 Thanks for reporting this issue. I agree that this scenario that should somehow work üëç  But to fix this, it's probably not as easy as just removing the warning message since there is a reason why the warning is there as well

issue.title: Adjust default date for st.date_input if today's date is out of bounds

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
The core issue with #6167 seems to not be the session state warning, but instead that we try
to set the default value of the `st.date_input` widget to today's date even if that date is not
within the specified min/max date interval.

This PR fixes this by setting the default to either the min or max date if today's date is out of
bounds.

Closes #6167
